title: After Two Weeks of Flight Cancellations, Airlines Assess What Went Wrong
sub_head: Omicron decimates airlines’ already-stretched workforces, but not travelers’ appetite to fly
body:
At JetBlue Airways Corp. , executives felt confident coming into the Christmas and New Year holiday season. The airline had flown through Thanksgiving week with hardly any hiccups.
Then Covid-19’s Omicron variant arrived. With its headquarters in New York, which leads the country in new case counts, JetBlue was quickly overwhelmed. Daily sick calls more than quadrupled, Chief Executive Robin Hayes said. On Dec. 21, JetBlue canceled no flights. Four days later, on Christmas Day, it scrapped 12% of its schedule.
